title: Honor Wall - Suggestion about the Honor System
body:
I really like the Honor system, but sometimes it feels like just a honor point it is  not enough:

It would be nice if under the green button is a text input, doesn't have to be long, 100 characters or so. In this input one writes a little message, if one wants naturally, it wont be mandatory.

And then in a page in the summoners profile there will be an "Honor wall" with icons from the Summoners champions from that game that gave the comment, something like this :

http://i.imgur.com/FsrvYXN.png

I guess summoners that commented should be anonymous to visitors to the wall, But the owner can visit the commentator's profile by clicking the champion icon.
The comments must be approved by the owner for public display, so there wont be comments like "Biggest KS-er NA! FU!".

If a comment is not approved after a week it can be auto deleted, so if one does not wont to bother wont have to.

This can be also a good opportunity for a gift summoner icon from Riot: "1k approved Honor comment" icon.

@Lyte now THIS is something we can do with the honor system.


Some limits that should be put in, or at least considered:

* The amount of comments that you can give: Probably shouldn't put a limit on this. You'd have to first honor the person you're praising, and you can still be reported for giving rude/inappropriate comments.


* How long the comments last: I think 60 days is a good spot before they're purged, and you can mark for saving the ones you really like.


* How many you can have: Some number divisible by 10 that doesn't invalidate the best people who get a lot of honors. 30-50-80 feel like good spots, and you can always prune them yourself or save for keeping.

I think there is no reason to put a limit on how many you can have. Messages are short and I think the server will have no problem on hosting even 500 or 600 messages per user (considering that most "casual" players never reach that number of games).

It's not just numbers, it's logistics. They -could- have the server space needed, and it could even be doable to allow unlimited/ultra-high comment storage.

But you wouldn't look through that many. That's a fuckton of illegible (and they will be if it's random players) sentences that would be a giant mass of words.

In addition, getting a "Great game!" comment is a drop in the bucket when you already have 438 comments in your bank just like it. With the 30-50-80 limit, you have the best of the ones you've received, and they can put in a counter for every comment you've had, the saved, new, and deleted ones.

I can pretty much guarantee that if the Player Behavior team DID make a system like this, they would keep the smaller limit. Not only would it save data space (say hello to our lack of saved replays), but it would keep each one you get ***-special-***, making you want to earn more not just for a number, but to keep your inbox new and unique over the run of a season.
